name: Pocket Monsters Midori
description:
In this game you are a 10-year-old boy, now old enough to receive your first Pokémon. You train this Pokémon by using it to battle with other Pokémon. Your main objective is to collect 8 gym badges to face the Elite Four and Pokémon League Champion of Kanto. You do this by defeating each gym leader in a Pokémon battle.

There are two parts in gameplay to this game. The first is your main character. You walk from place to place, goes up to talk to people, and find items. The second part of the gameplay happens when another Trainer has seen you, or you come across a wild Pokémon.

In the Pokémon battle, you can select from four options: Attack, Pokémon, Item, and Run. In the attack option, you choose from the Pokémon's attacks to use on the opponents Pokémon. This either drains their HP (lowering a Pokémon's HP to zero will knock them out), inflicts a status condition (like sleeping or poison), or changes stats (attack power, speed, etc). In the Pokémon option you can switch the active Pokémon in battle. In the item option you can either use items on your Pokémon (to heal them), or in a wild Pokémon battle you can throw a Poké Ball to catch them. The run option is only available in battles with wild Pokémon, you cannot run from a Trainer. The battle ends when one Trainer has no remaining Pokémon.

Your rival is always one step ahead of you, and challenging you to battles. You will run into the Rocket Gang, a group of criminals who use Pokémon for evil purposes. You must defeat many of their grunts and their leader in order to foil their evil schemes.

You can also link up to Pocket Monster Akai in order to trade Pokémon or battle with your friends. This is necessary to get all 150 Pokémon, because not all of them appear in Midori.

shot.caption: Opening animation
Title screen
Welcome the world of Pocket Monsters.
Your first pokemon... awaits you on that desk.
Pokemon sure looked a lot more terrifying at their inception...
Checking the map...
Badges, bosses cleared and those yet to be beaten.
A dark cave will need a special move to light it up.
Agh! A ghost! Nothing we can do!
Leech seeding the opponent, now my beast will absorb its health...
Aww... it leveled up ^^
Trimming the flowers.
A sinful little diversion
In the golden city, a gang of thieves have taken over. A Rocket gangster blocks the door.
A crotchety old man blocks the road... Well if it is his property.
Giovanni, the big boss of Team Rocket... What's he doing here!
Jumping a ledge.
This fellow teaches bystanders how to catch weedles.
Freezing a baleful wisp.
A trainer spots anything that moves, looking for battle.
A cleansing field, this will heal your body, and those of your pocket monsters, in this indoor gravehall.
Damn sung to sleep.
Horn (ice cream cone?) attack!
Pewter city gym, everything is gray in these parts.
A Pokedex entry
I'd also be confused.
The prey has shrunken itself, this fellow is going to be a pain to hit.
Lobbing a pokeball at a rare specimen.
Surfing in a subterranean cove.
A legendary bird is waiting for you here.
Checking a monsters stats.
This looks like the end of the cute vermin.
A pitched battle
The more graphical effects, the stronger the attack.
Giovanni again! How many subterfuges, and clandestine overlordships, can this man be involved in?!
My cute little monster has become a terrifying forest that shoots rays of condensed sunshine out of its back.
Pushing a boulder onto a switch.
Almost at the end... this is the maze of champions!
This can't be good...
And my whole team is wiped out... the world begins to darken before my eyes... but I still see _its_ grin!
The bat knows some sort of flashy hypnosis.
The shock my babyhood rival _is the champion_
The hall of fame... is that a Dell?
A record of my brawlers in the hall of fame.
Yeah sure buddy, and I've got a bridge to sell ya in Brooklyn.
A Team Rocket grunt blocks the way.
That bike is a bit too rich for my blood.
What's the matter boy?
Holy-!
Fishing, looks like something is on the hook.
A big cruiser, will adventure never cease?
Elderly gentlemen part with gracious sums...
